text: Ali Emadi is a Canada Excellence Research Chair in Hybrid Powertrain at McMaster University in Hamilton, Ontario. He was named a Fellow of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) in 2013 for his contributions to electric power conversion and control for electric and hybrid vehicles. In 2017, he was named a fellow of the National Academy of Inventors. ==References== ==External links== * Category:20th-century births Category:Living people Category:Texas A&M; University alumni Category:McMaster University faculty Category:Fellow Members of the IEEE Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Place of birth missing (living people)
title: Ali Emadi
